factoid: Natásha’s skirt was too long.
Natásha’s skirt caused the delay.
Two maids were turning up the hem of Natásha’s skirt.
Two maids were hurriedly biting off the ends of thread.
A third maid had pins in her mouth and was running about between the countess and Sónya.
A fourth maid held the whole of the gossamer garment up high on one hand.
Mávra said 'quicker, darling!'.
The count asked 'Whenever will you be ready?'.
Perónskaya must be tired of waiting.
The maid said the dress was ready.
The maid held up the shortened gauze dress with two fingers.
The maid blew and shook something off the dress.
Natásha began putting on the dress.
Natásha cried 'In a minute! In a minute! Don’t come in, Papa!'.
Natásha’s father opened the door.
Natásha spoke from under the filmy skirt.
The filmy skirt still covered Natásha’s whole face.
Sónya slammed the door.
The count was let in a minute later.
The count was wearing a blue swallow-tail coat.
The count was wearing shoes.
The count was wearing stockings.
The count was perfumed.
The count’s hair was pomaded.
Natásha cried 'Oh, Papa! how nice you look! Charming!'.
Natásha stood in the middle of the room.
Natásha was smoothing out the folds of the gauze.
The maid said 'If you please, Miss! allow me.'.
The maid was on her knees.
The maid was pulling the skirt straight.
The maid was shifting the pins from one side of her mouth to the other with her tongue.
Sónya exclaimed 'Say what you like.'.
Sónya looked at Natásha.
Sónya said 'say what you like, it’s still too long.'.
Natásha stepped back to look at herself in the pier glass.
The dress was too long.
Mávra said 'Really, madam, it is not at all too long.'.
Mávra was crawling on her knees after Natásha.
Dunyásha said 'Well, if it’s too long we’ll tack it up... we’ll tack it up in one minute.'.
Dunyásha was taking a needle that was stuck on the front of her little shawl.
Dunyásha was still kneeling on the floor.
Dunyásha set to work once more.
The countess came in shyly.
The countess was wearing a cap.
The countess was wearing a velvet gown.
The count would have embraced the countess.
The countess stepped aside fearing to be rumpled.
The countess was blushing.
Natásha said 'Mamma, your cap, more to this side'.
Natásha said 'I’ll arrange it'.
Natásha rushed forward.
The maids were tacking up Natásha’s skirt.
A piece of gauze was torn off.
Natásha said 'Oh goodness! What has happened? Really it was not my fault!'.
Dunyásha said 'Never mind, I’ll run it up, it won’t show'.
The nurse said 'What a beauty—a very queen!'.
The nurse said 'And Sónya! They are lovely!'.
At a quarter past ten they got into their carriages.
They started their journey.
They still had to call at the Taurida Gardens.
Perónskaya was ready.
Perónskaya had gone through the same process as the Rostóvs.
Perónskaya’s process had less flurry.
Perónskaya’s body was washed.
Perónskaya’s body was perfumed.
Perónskaya’s body was powdered.
Perónskaya washed behind Perónskaya’s ears as carefully.
Perónskaya entered her drawing room in a yellow dress.
Perónskaya wore her badge as maid of honor.
Perónskaya’s old lady’s maid admired Perónskaya.
The Rostóvs’ servants admired Perónskaya.
Perónskaya praised the Rostóvs’ toilets.
The Rostóvs praised Perónskaya’s taste.
The Rostóvs praised Perónskaya’s toilet.
At eleven o’clock they settled themselves in their carriages.
They drove off.
Natásha had not had a moment free since early morning.
Natásha had not had time to think of what lay before Natásha.
